intro: Melampyrum saxosum subsp. javorkae, commonly known as the Balkan dead-nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. This subspecies is native to southeastern Europe and is often found in calcareous soils.
